eu.trentorise.opendata.commons.validation

Class ARef

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.opendata.commons.validation.ARef
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Ref

    @Value.Immutable
abstract class ARef
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A reference to an element in a file. The reference is both logical (i.e. the path to a json node a.b.c) and physical (the row and column number (13,48) in the json file ).
    Author:
    David Leoni

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ARef() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void check() 
      String getDocumentId()
      An identifier (possibly but not necessarily an IRI) for the original document.
      long getPhysicalColumn()
      The column index in the physical file (starting from 0), in case the file of reference is in text format.
      long getPhysicalRow()
      The row index in the physical file (starting from 0), in case the file of reference is in text format.
      String getTracePath()
      A reference to one or more elements inside the document identified by documentId.
      static Ref ofDocumentId(String documentId)
      Creates a reference to a document.
      static Ref ofPath(String tracePath)
      Creates a reference out of a TracePath format.
      String uri()
      Builds an uri for the reference like this: documentId#tracePath; If any of the two components is empty, the '#' is omitted

    • Constructor Detail

      • ARef

        ARef()

    • Method Detail

      • getDocumentId

        @Value.Default
public String getDocumentId()
        An identifier (possibly but not necessarily an IRI) for the original document. In case the data was obtained through a query the id could be the endpoint address with the query parameters.

      • getPhysicalRow

        @Value.Default
public long getPhysicalRow()
        The row index in the physical file (starting from 0), in case the file of reference is in text format. In case parameter is not set -1 is returned.

      • getPhysicalColumn

        @Value.Default
public long getPhysicalColumn()
        The column index in the physical file (starting from 0), in case the file of reference is in text format. In case parameter is not set -1 is returned.

      • getTracePath

        @Value.Default
public String getTracePath()
        A reference to one or more elements inside the document identified by documentId. The reference is expressed as a TracePath . By default it is the empty string (which we assume selects everything, along with '*').

      • check

        @Value.Check
protected void check()

      • ofPath

        public static Ref ofPath(String tracePath)
        Creates a reference out of a TracePath format. The path is considered relative to an unspecified document.
        Parameters:
        tracePath - A reference to one or more elements expressed as TracePath
        See Also:
        ofDocumentId(String)

      • ofDocumentId

        public static Ref ofDocumentId(String documentId)
        Creates a reference to a document.
        Parameters:
        documentId - an identifier for a document (possibly an IRI).
        See Also:
        ofPath(String)

      • uri

        public String uri()
        Builds an uri for the reference like this: documentId#tracePath; If any of the two components is empty, the '#' is omitted
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if both documentid and tracepath are empty.
